policyFindings: In-cabin pets (BA-operated flights): Pets are not accepted in the cabin on British Airways operated flights; only recognised assistance dogs may travel in the cabin.
Emotional Support Animals (ESAs): British Airways does not accept emotional support dogs in the cabin on any BA-operated flight; ESAs may travel as pets (i.e., not in cabin on BA metal).

Assistance/service dogs in cabin (who qualifies): Dogs must be trained by or accredited with ADI/IGDF/ADAA, or equivalent standard with evidence; must show appropriate behaviour and remain under control.

Assistance/service dogs booking and approval: You must register via British Airways' Open Doors Organization portal; BA recommends registering before booking and finalising at least 48 hours before travel.

Assistance/service dogs harness/seat: A car safety harness (or equivalent) is required for take-off/landing and when seat belt signs are on; BA may limit the number of assistance dogs carried in the cabin.

UK arrivals with assistance dogs: Contact the relevant UK Animal Reception Centre (ARC) at least 72 hours before your flight to request approval; you will receive a pre-approval letter (LCY is handled differently per BA's page).
USA travel with dogs: Additional CDC requirements apply to all dogs entering the U.S.; completion of the CDC Dog Import Form is required before boarding.

SUN-AIR (BA franchise) in-cabin pet exception: On SUN-AIR flights (within Europe under the BA brand), recognised assistance dogs are allowed in cabin; other pets up to 6 kg are permitted in a waterproof bag/cage max 20 x 30 x 20 cm; one pet per aircraft; owner must ensure documents; contact SUN-AIR at least 72 hours before departure; pets are not permitted on SUN-AIR flights to the UK.
Cargo/transporting pets (from the UK): BA partners with PetAir UK to export pets.
Cargo/transporting pets (to the UK): BA directs customers to sister company IAG Cargo to import pets.

Checked pets vs cargo (contract language): BA's Conditions of Carriage state domestic pets may be carried as checked baggage or cargo according to BA's policy at the time; all other animals must be carried as cargo; assistance dogs travel free in cabin (BA may charge if an adjacent seat must be withdrawn). Note: BA's customer-facing pet page currently directs customers to PetAir UK/IAG Cargo rather than booking checked pets directly with BA.
Fees - assistance dogs: Carried free of charge; BA may charge if an adjacent seat must be removed from use.
Fees - pets as cargo: Fees are arranged/quoted by the transport partners (PetAir UK or IAG Cargo); BA does not publish a fee table on its site.
Carriers/containers - in-cabin carriers on BA: Not applicable (pets not permitted in cabin on BA-operated flights).
Carriers/containers - in-cabin carriers on SUN-AIR: Waterproof bag/cage up to 20 x 30 x 20 cm.

Carriers/containers - hold transport: Animals must be in proper, adequate and secure containers when carried as checked baggage; specific crate sizes are not listed on BA's site (cargo provider requirements apply).

Breed restrictions: No BA-operated flight breed list is published on the BA pet pages; breed/route/temperature restrictions may be set by the cargo provider and destination authorities (DEFRA for UK entry).

Embargoes/temperature limits: No BA-wide seasonal or temperature embargo policy is published on BA's pet page; cargo provider may impose route/temperature embargoes—confirm with the provider for your itinerary.
Entry rules to the UK: BA points customers to the UK Government's Pet Travel Scheme (DEFRA) for requirements to enter the UK.

Seating for passengers with an assistance dog: BA's Conditions of Carriage state that if a bulkhead seat is required due to travelling with an assistance dog in cabin, BA will provide it if not already assigned to another passenger with a disability.
notes: Scope and limits: BA's customer page directs all pet transport to partners (PetAir UK for exports from the UK; IAG Cargo for imports to the UK). As a result, BA's own site does not publish pet cargo fees, detailed crate specifications, or breed-specific restrictions; these are typically provided by the cargo provider and by destination authority rules.

Practical next steps: If you need to move a pet on a BA itinerary, plan on arranging transport through the referenced partners; if travelling with a qualified assistance dog, complete BA's Open Doors Organization registration and any route-specific requirements (e.g., CDC form for US; UK ARC pre-approval for UK arrivals) within the timelines above.
Terminology: BA refers to 'assistance dogs'/'service dogs' and explicitly distinguishes them from emotional support animals. ESAs are not accepted in cabin on BA-operated flights.

finalDoc.PetPolicySummary:
Travelling with pets
We know your pets are part of your family, which is why we treat every animal who flies with us like a VIP.

An assistance dog laying down with their harness on.
British Airways flights
Emotional support dogs

British Airways is unable to accept emotional support dogs for travel in the cabin on any British Airways operated flights. Your emotional support dog can travel as a pet and details on how to arrange this can be found below.

Assistance Dogs

If you’re travelling with an assistance dog, it can travel with you free of charge in the cabin of your British Airways flight. This service cannot be booked online and we might need to limit the number of dogs we can carry in the cabin.

More about travelling with assistance dogs
Pets
PetAir UK logo.
From the UK
We’ve partnered with PetAir UK, which is run and owned by fully-qualified veterinary surgeons and has been flying pets all over the world since 2004, to offer British Airways customers a safe, comfortable and convenient way to export their pets from the UK.

More about transporting Pets with PetAir UK
IAG Cargo logo.
To the UK
If you are looking to transport your pet to the UK, our sister company IAG Cargo can help. They have decades of experience transporting animals from every corner of the globe and will look after your pet as if it were their own.

More about transporting pets with IAG Cargo
Pet Travel Scheme
If you're entering the UK, your dog must meet the requirements of the Pet Travel Scheme offered by the UK Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs (DEFRA). It allows cats and dogs to travel between some countries and UK airports avoiding quarantine.

If you're travelling to a different country, please check with the relevant embassy or consulate for any regulations or restrictions.

More about DEFRA's Pet Travel scheme
SUN-AIR flights
SUN-AIR is our franchise partner operating flights within Europe under the British Airways brand. As on British Airways operated flights, recognised assistance dogs are allowed in the cabin, as well as other pets up to 6kg.

Other pets must be transported in a waterproof bag or cage, with maximum dimensions of 20 x 30 x 20cm (7.5 x 11.5 x 7.5in).
It is the owners’ responsibility to ensure that all documentation and animal passports are in order before departure.
SUN-AIR permits one pet on board each aircraft at one time.
Please contact the SUN-AIR ticket office on +45 75 33 16 11 no later than 72 hours before departure if you wish to bring your pet on a SUN-AIR operated flight. Please note that pets are not permitted on SUN-AIR flights to the United Kingdom.
finalDoc.ImprovedPetPolicySummary:
British Airways Pet Policy (Summary)

  • BA-operated flights: Pets are not accepted in the cabin; only recognised assistance dogs may travel in-cabin free of charge (numbers may be limited).
  • Emotional Support Animals: ESAs are not accepted in the cabin on BA-operated flights. They must travel as pets via cargo arrangements.
  • Pet transport logistics: From the UK, arrange export with PetAir UK. To the UK, arrange with IAG Cargo. Fees, crate specs and any route/temperature limits are set by the cargo provider and authorities.
  • UK entry rules: Follow the UK DEFRA Pet Travel Scheme requirements when entering the UK.
  • SUN-AIR (BA franchise) exception: Permits one pet per aircraft in cabin up to 6 kg, in a waterproof bag/cage max 20 x 30 x 20 cm; contact SUN-AIR at least 72 hours before departure; pets are not permitted on SUN-AIR flights to the UK.
  • Assistance dogs: Must be trained/qualified (e.g., ADI/IGDF or equivalent), registered via BA’s Open Doors Organization portal, and secured with an appropriate harness during take-off/landing and when seat belt signs are on. For UK arrivals, obtain pre-approval from the Animal Reception Centre at least 72 hours before travel; for US travel, comply with CDC dog import requirements.
finalDoc.inCompartmentDetails: Pets are not accepted in the cabin on BA-operated flights (only recognised assistance dogs). Exception: On SUN-AIR (BA franchise) flights within Europe, one pet per aircraft is permitted up to 6 kg in a waterproof bag/cage (20 x 30 x 20 cm); pets are not permitted on SUN-AIR flights to the UK and SUN-AIR must be contacted at least 72 hours before departure.
finalDoc.inCargoDetails: From the UK, pet transport is arranged via PetAir UK. To the UK, transport is arranged via IAG Cargo. Fees, crate requirements, and any breed/temperature or route restrictions are set by the cargo provider and destination authorities; BA does not publish cargo pet fee tables on its site.
finalDoc.carrierCompartmentDetails: Not applicable on BA-operated flights (pets are not permitted in the cabin). SUN-AIR (BA franchise) allows a waterproof bag/cage up to 20 x 30 x 20 cm for pets up to 6 kg.
finalDoc.carrierCargoDetails: When carried as checked baggage/cargo, animals must be in proper, adequate and secure containers; specific crate sizes and standards are determined by the cargo provider (PetAir UK/IAG Cargo) and applicable IATA/authority requirements.
finalDoc.serviceAnimalDetails:
Assistance/Service Dogs on British Airways

  • Accepted free of charge in the cabin on BA-operated flights; numbers may be limited.
  • Eligibility: Trained and accredited to assist with a disability/medical condition (e.g., ADI/IGDF or equivalent standard with evidence).
  • Registration: Complete BA’s assistance dog registration via the Open Doors Organization portal. BA recommends completing registration before booking and finalising at least 48 hours before travel. Not bookable online.
  • Onboard safety: A car safety harness (or equivalent) is required during taxi, take-off, landing and whenever the seat belt sign is on. The dog must remain under your control and behave appropriately in public and on board.
  • Seating: Bulkhead seating will be provided if required and available. BA may restrict the number of assistance dogs per flight.
  • Route-specific rules: For arrivals to the UK, obtain pre-approval from the relevant Animal Reception Centre at least 72 hours before your flight. For travel to the USA, comply with CDC dog import requirements (including completing the CDC Dog Import Form before boarding).
